The <InputNumber/> component is similar to the Input component, but it has controls for incrementing or decrementing numeric values. Source@matro-ui/inputnumber
import { InputNumber, InputNumberField } from "matro-ui"; Copy InputNumber: The wrapper that provides context and logic to the components. InputNumberField: The input field itself.

Combine <InputNumber/>, <InputText/>, <InputChildSelect/>, <InputChildPrefix/> as you prefer to create any kind of input: Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack column> <LabelText>Example of currency-num</LabelText> <InputNumber placeholder="0.00"> <InputChildPrefix value="$"/> <InputNumberField/> <InputChildSelect name="select-name-prop" defaultValue="pln"> <option value="eur">EUR</option> <option value="usd">USD</option> <option value="pln">PLN</option> </InputChildSelect> </InputNumber> </Stack> Loading... Copy Live Editor function Search () { const [value, setValue] = React.useState("") const handleChange = (e) => { setValue(e.target.value); } return( <Stack column> <LabelText>Example of search</LabelText> <InputText placeholder="Search..." value={value} onChange={handleChange}> <InputTextField/> <InputChildButton children={<IoSearch />} onClick={() => {alert("Query: " + value); setValue("");}}/> </InputText> </Stack> ); } Loading... Copy Live Editor <label> <LabelText>Example of link-text</LabelText> <InputText color="cyangreen" placeholder="example.com" name="input-name-prop" > <InputChildPrefix value="https://"/> <InputTextField/> <InputChildSelect/> </InputText> </label>

value DescriptionThe value of the input. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the input value changes. Typefunction name DescriptionThe name attribute of the input. Typestring placeholder DescriptionPlaceholder attribute of the input. Typestring disabled DescriptionDisables the input. Typeboolean

name DescriptionThe name attribute of the input. Typestring defaultValue DescriptionThe default value of the select input. Typeboolean children Description<option> jsx tags with provided "value" attr TypeReact.FC | React.FC[]
children DescriptionThe string value of the label. Typestring
The <LabelText/> component allows to provide a label text to any field, input, select or textarea. Source@matro-ui/labeltext
Loading... Copy Live Editor <label> <LabelText>Your email:</LabelText> <InputText placeholder="john@example.com"> <InputTextField/> </InputText> </label>
Loading... Copy Live Editor // import { IoMailUnreadOutline } from "react-icons/io5";
children DescriptionLabel content TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string
The <Textarea/> component simplifies the creation of text inputs that span multiple lines. info This item is currently under construction and will be available in v.0.8.0.
The <Slider/> component simplifies the creation of embeded image gallery, or slider. info This item is currently under construction and will be available in v.0.9.2.
The <Hide/> component is a simple way to hide someithing specific when media condition is true. info This item is currently under construction and will be available in v.0.9.1.
The <Select/> component allows to select or deselect options in a form. It provides a customizable checkbox input with various options. Source@matro-ui/select
import { Select, SelectGroup } from "matro-ui"; Copy SelectGroup: The wrapper that provides context and logic to the components. Select: The select input itself.
Loading... Copy Live Editor <SelectGroup defaultValue="_"> <Select value="_" disabled>Select Value</Select> <Select value="2">2</Select> <Select value="3">3</Select> </SelectGroup>

Pass the fitContent prop to set width value to: fit-content. Loading... Copy Live Editor <SelectGroup defaultValue="_" fitContent> <Select value="_" disabled>Select Value</Select> <Select value="2">2</Select> <Select value="3">3</Select> </SelectGroup>

defaultValue DescriptionThe defauilt value of the group. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the input value changes. Typefunction name DescriptionThe name attribute of the input. Typestring style DescriptionAdditional styling prop. Typeobject children DescriptionAny possible React Children. At least one <Select/> is required. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number fitContent DescriptionSet width to fit-content if true. Typeboolean
value DescriptionSelect option value. Typestring | number disabled DescriptionDisables of the select option. Typeboolean
The <Minmax/> component is a simple way to show props.children only in the specific viewport range. info This item is currently under construction and will be available in v.0.9.1.
The <Stack/> is a layout component that allows to group components together and create a space between them. Source@matro-ui/stack
import { Stack } from "matro-ui"; Copy Stack: The stack layout component itself.

children DescriptionThe children/s of the Stack. Typeany wrap DescriptionIndicates whether the Stack has to wrap the overflow items / or shrink the existing ones. Typeboolean column DescriptionSet Stack direction to column if true. Typeboolean Defaultbool:false justify DescriptionSet Stack items justify option. Type"start" | "end" | "center" | "spaceBetween" | "spaceAround" Default"start" align DescriptionSet Stack items align option. Type"start" | "end" | "center" | "stretch" Default"start" padding DescriptionSet Stack padding (inner spacing) Typestring | number margin DescriptionSet Stack margin (outside spacing) Typestring | number gap DescriptionStack items gap (spacing between items) Typestring | number Default5px
The <Show/> component is a simple way to show someithing specific when media condition is true. info This item is currently under construction and will be available in v.0.9.1.
The <InputText/> component allows to get user input in a text field. Source@matro-ui/inputtext
import { InputText, InputTextField } from "matro-ui"; Copy InputNumber: The wrapper that provides context and logic to the components. InputNumberField: The input field itself.
Loading... Copy Live Editor <InputText placeholder="Start typing..."> <InputTextField/> </InputText>
Loading... Copy Live Editor <InputText disabled placeholder="Disabled"> <InputTextField/> </InputText>

Combine <InputNumber/>, <InputText/>, <InputChildSelect/>, <InputChildPrefix/> as you prefer to create any kind of input: Loading... Typestring placeholder DescriptionPlaceholder attribute of the input. Typestring disabled DescriptionDisables of the input. Typeboolean

The <LinkButton/> component render link as button that allows to use <a> tag without breaking W3C markup rules. Source@matro-ui/LinkButton
import { LinkButton } from "matro-ui"; Copy LinkButton: The LinkButton component itself
Loading... Copy Live Editor } > Hi! I'm a Link myself 👋🏾
You can also use it as a wrapper to a react-router-dom <Link/>, or other navigation component Loading... Copy Live Editor <LinkButton as={<Link to="#"/>}> LinkButton as {`<Link/>`} </LinkButton>

<Button/> specification allows us to add a custom Icon, by simply using leftIcon or rightIcon prop (val: any): Loading... Copy Live Editor <LinkButton as={<Link to="#"/>} leftIcon={<IoLayersOutline color="darkturquoise"/>} > LinkButton as {`<Link/>`} </LinkButton>

all from <Button/> spec, and: children Description Any possible React Children, usually string. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number as DescriptionWill be converted to a parent item, with provided props. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number
The <Checkbox/> component allows to select or deselect options in a form. It provides a customizable checkbox input with various options. Source@matro-ui/checkbox
import { Checkbox } from "matro-ui"; Copy Checkbox: Checkbox input
Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20}}> <Checkbox disabled> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox disabled checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> </Stack>

Pass the font-size to change the size of the Checkbox. Values can be either px, em, rem or %. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20, alignItems: "flex-end"}}> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "14px"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "16px"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "1.2rem"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> </Stack>

You can override the color scheme of the Checkbox to any color by providing the css variable --bg. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20, alignItems: "flex-end"}}> <Checkbox style={{"--bg": "red"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{"--bg": "#48b07d"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{"--bg": "#4848d7"}} checked> Checkbox </Checkbox> </Stack>

Pass the toggle prop to change the view of the Checkbox. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20, alignItems: "flex-end"}}> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "14px"}} checked toggle> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "16px"}} checked toggle> Checkbox </Checkbox> <Checkbox style={{fontSize: "1.2rem", "--bg": "#48b07d"}} checked toggle> Checkbox </Checkbox> </Stack>
Alternatively, you can use the <Toggle/> component. It wraps Checkbox and pass all props to it. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Toggle style={{fontSize: "1.1rem"}} checked toggle> Toggle </Toggle>

name DescriptionThe name attribute of the checkbox. Typestring value DescriptionThe value of the checkbox. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the checkbox value changes. Typefunction checked DescriptionIndicates whether the checkbox is checked. Typeboolean toggle DescriptionChanges checkbox view to toggle if true. Typeboolean linear DescriptionSets linear type of animation if true. Typeboolean
The <Radio/> component allows to select or deselect options in a form. It provides a customizable checkbox input with various options. Source@matro-ui/radio
import { Radio, RadioGroup } from "matro-ui"; Copy RadioGroup: The wrapper that provides context and logic to the components. Radio: The radio input itself.
Loading... Copy Live Editor <RadioGroup defaultValue="2"> <Radio value="1">Value 1</Radio> <Radio value="2">Value 2</Radio> </Radio>

Pass the disabled prop to disable any radio option. Loading... Copy Live Editor <RadioGroup defaultValue="2"> <Radio value="1" disabled>Value 1</Radio> <Radio value="2" disabled>Value 2</Radio> <Radio value="3">Value 3</Radio> </Radio>

Pass the font-size to change the size of the Radio. Values can be either px, em, rem or %. Loading... Copy Live Editor <RadioGroup defaultValue="2" style={{fontSize: "21px"}}> <Radio value="1" style={{fontSize: "0.7em"}}>Value 1</Radio> <Radio value="2">Value 2</Radio> <Radio value="3">Value 3</Radio> </Radio>

You can override the color scheme of the radio to any color by providing the css variable --bg to RadioGroup or Radio. Loading... Copy Live Editor <RadioGroup defaultValue="2" style={{"--bg": "purple"}}> <Radio value="1">Value 1</Radio> <Radio value="2" style={{"--bg": "#48b048"}}>Value 2</Radio> <Radio value="3" style={{"--bg": "#4848d7"}}>Value 3</Radio> </RadioGroup>

defaultValue DescriptionThe defauilt value of the group. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the input value changes. Typefunction name DescriptionThe name attribute of the input. Typestring style DescriptionAdditional styling prop. Typeobject children DescriptionAny possible React Children. At least one <Group/> is required. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number

value DescriptionRadio input value. Typestring | number style DescriptionAdditional styling prop. Typeobject disabled DescriptionDisables the input. Typeboolean children DescriptionLabel of the radio input. Typestring
The <Key/> component show which key or combination of keys performs a given action. Source@matro-ui/Key
import { Key } from "matro-ui"; Copy Key: Keyboard key component

Use modifiers such as "+", "then", "or" to clearly represent the action to the users. All single letters A-Z should be uppercase. Use the symbol as opposed to spelling things out. Use the symbols that are commonly used. "&" may not be familiar to users from Central Europe or Asia.

To add a more vintage look to the , set the prop vintage (val: boolean): Loading... Copy Live Editor
Ctrl + M
children DescriptionAny possible React Children. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number vintage DescriptionVintage styling if set to true. Typeboolean Defaultfalse
The <Accordion/> component render breadcrumbs that show the user where they are in the site's hierarchy. Source@matro-ui/accordion

import { Accordion, AccordionItem, AccordionButton } from "matro-ui"; Copy Accordion: The wrapper that provides context and logic to the components AccordionItem: Individual accordion element containing a button. AccordionButton: The button that toggles show/hide state of the accordion item

Loading... Copy Live Editor Accordion Item 1 Content 1 Accordion Item 2
Content 2

You can pass the setIcon prop callback to change the default icon and render it conditionaly based on the props.isOpened argument. Loading... Copy Live Editor props.isOpened ? "🚀" : <>😴}> Item #1 content 1 Item #2
content 2
To make the opened by default, pass the isOpened prop to it: Loading... Copy Live Editor Item #1 Hi! I'm opened by default! 👋🏿

children Description Any possible React Children. At least one <AccordionItem/> is required. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number setIcon DescriptionCallback function that sets custom Icon to each child (<AccordionItem/>) and recieves props.isOpened to render it conditionally. Typefunction

children Description Any possible React Children. At least one <AccordionButton/> is required. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number setIcon DescriptionCallback function that sets custom Icon and recieves props.isOpened to render it conditionally. Typefunction isOpened DescriptionOpened by default if set to true. Typeboolean Defaultfalse
children Description Any possible React Children. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number
The <Breadcrumbs/> component render breadcrumbs that show the user where they are in the site's hierarchy. Source@matro-ui/breadcrumbs
import { Breadcrumbs, BreadcrumbsItem } from "matro-ui"; Copy Breadcrumbs: The wrapper that provides context and logic to the components BreadcrumbsItem: The Breadcrumbs item

Loading... Copy Live Editor <Breadcrumbs divider="🚀"> <BreadcrumbsItem> <Link to="#">Home</Link> </BreadcrumbsItem> <BreadcrumbsItem> <Link to="#">Products</Link> </BreadcrumbsItem> <BreadcrumbsItem> <Link to="#">Course 1</Link> </BreadcrumbsItem> </Breadcrumbs>

By default, <Breadcrumbs/> last divider is hidden. To change this behaviour, simply add showLastDivider prop: Loading... Copy Live Editor <Breadcrumbs divider="👉" showLastDivider> {["Link1", "Link2", "Link3"].map(link => <BreadcrumbsItem key={uuid()}> <Link to={`/${link}`}>{link}</Link> </BreadcrumbsItem> )} </Breadcrumbs>

By default, <Breadcrumbs/> last item is inactive. To change this behaviour, simply add lastActive prop: Loading... Copy Live Editor <Breadcrumbs lastActive> <BreadcrumbsItem> <Link to="#">Link 1</Link> </BreadcrumbsItem> <BreadcrumbsItem> <Link to="#">Link 2</Link> </BreadcrumbsItem> </Breadcrumbs>

<Breadcrumbs/> default divider is "/". To change it set divider prop (val: any): Loading... Copy Live Editor // import { IoIosArrowForward } from "react-icons/io"; <Breadcrumbs divider={<IoIosArrowForward />}> {["Link1", "Link2", "Link3"].map(link => <BreadcrumbsItem key={uuid()}> <Link to={`/${link}`}>{link}</Link> </BreadcrumbsItem> )} </Breadcrumbs>

children Description Any possible React Children. At least one <BreadcrumbsItem/> is required. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number divider DescriptionCustom divider. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number Default"/" showLastDivider DescriptionShows last divider if set to true. Typeboolean Defaultfalse lastActive Description Makes last <BreadcrumbsItem/> accessible. Typeboolean Defaultfalse
The <Button/> component render breadcrumbs that show the user where they are in the site's hierarchy. Source@matro-ui/Button
import { Button } from "matro-ui"; Copy Button: Button component itself.

To change the color of the <Button/>, simply pass the hue(MDN Docs) prop to it: Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack> <Button hue="100">Button</Button> <Button hue="200" leftIcon={<IoMailUnreadOutline/>}>Button</Button> <Button hue="240" leftIcon={<Spinner size="XS"/>}>Button</Button> </Stack>

To make the button "glossy", add the glossy prop to it: Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack> <Button colorScheme="black" glossy>Button</Button> <Button leftIcon={<IoMailUnreadOutline/>} hue="160" glossy>Button</Button> </Stack>

To add the Icon to the <Button/>, simply pass it to the leftIcon or rightIcon prop: Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack column> <Button leftIcon={<PiGear size="21" style={{margin: "0 -1px 0 -1px"}}/>} hue="260" > User Settings </Button> <Button leftIcon={<PiBluetooth size="20" style={{margin: "0 -3px 0 1px"}}/>} hue="200" > Bluetooth </Button> </Stack>

If you want to make a Button with only Icon inside, use isIcon prop to set it right spacing to 0: Loading... Copy Live Editor // import { PiGear } from "react-icons/pi"; <Button leftIcon={<PiGear size="21" style={{margin: "0 -1px 0 -1px"}}/>} hue="260" isIcon />

children Description Any possible React Children. TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number leftIcon DescriptionLeft-side Icon. Any possible React Children. Usually <svg/> or "string" TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number rightIcon DescriptionRight-side Icon. Any possible React Children. Usually <svg/> or "string" TypeReact.FC | React.FC[] | string | number glossy DescriptionAdds "glossy" effect to the button. Typeboolean isIcon DescriptionSets marginRight of Icon to 0. Typeboolean
The <Toggle/> is a simple wrapper for a <Checkbox/> component to show it as a toggle. Source@matro-ui/Toggle
import { Toggle } from "matro-ui"; Copy Toggle: Toggle input

Pass the font-size to change the size of the Toggle. Values can be either px, em, rem or %. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20, alignItems: "flex-end"}}> <Toggle style={{fontSize: "14px"}} checked> Toggle </Toggle> <Toggle style={{fontSize: "16px"}} checked> Toggle </Toggle> <Toggle style={{fontSize: "1.2rem"}} checked> Toggle </Toggle> </Stack>

You can override the color scheme of the Toggle to any color by providing the css variable --bg. Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack style={{gap: 20, alignItems: "flex-end"}}> <Toggle style={{"--bg": "red"}} checked> Toggle </Toggle> <Toggle style={{"--bg": "#48b07d"}} checked> Toggle </Toggle> <Toggle style={{"--bg": "#4848d7"}} checked> Toggle </Toggle> </Stack>

name DescriptionThe name attribute of the Toggle. Typestring value DescriptionThe value of the Toggle. Typeboolean onChange DescriptionCallback function triggered when the Toggle value changes. Typefunction checked DescriptionIndicates whether the Toggle is checked. Typeboolean toggle DescriptionChanges Toggle view to toggle if true. Typeboolean linear DescriptionSets linear type of animation if true. Typeboolean
Matro UI provides you with the tools you need to create fast, beautiful and functional user interfaces. Here is an overview of the component categories:
Checkbox Input Number Input Text Radio Select Slider Textarea
The <Progress/> component allows to select or deselect options in a form. It provides a customizable checkbox input with various options. Source@matro-ui/Progress
import { Progress } from "matro-ui"; Copy Progress: Progress bar component
Loading... Copy Live Editor <label> <LabelText>Example of {`<Progress/>`}, 10%</LabelText> <Progress value={10} /> </label>

To change the height of <Progress/>, simply set the height prop (val. string | number): Loading... Copy Live Editor <label> <LabelText>Example of {`<Progress/>`}, 90%</LabelText> <Progress value={90} height="3" /> </label>

To change the color of <Progress/>, set the colorScheme prop (val. "red" | "orange" | "yellow" | "green" | "cyangreen" | "cyanblue" | "blue" | "purple" | "pink"): Loading... Copy Live Editor <label> <LabelText>Example of {`<Progress/>`}, 50%</LabelText> <Progress colorScheme="pink" value={50} height="3" /> </label>

value DescriptionProgress in %. Typestring | number height DescriptionHeight of the <Progress/>. Typestring | number Default"5px" colorScheme DescriptionShows last divider if set to true. Type"red" | "orange" | "yellow" | "green" | "cyangreen" | "cyanblue" | "blue" | "purple" | "pink" Default--hue: 160

The <Spinner/> component visually indicate that a process is underway and awaiting a change or outcome. Source@matro-ui/Spinner
import { Spinner } from "matro-ui"; Copy Spinner: Spinner component by itself.
To change the size of <Spinner/>, simply set the size prop (val."XS" | "S" | "M" | "L" | "XL"): Loading... Copy Live Editor <Spinner size="XL" />

To change the color of <Spinner/>, set the colorScheme prop (val. "red" | "orange" | "yellow" | "green" | "cyangreen" | "cyanblue" | "blue" | "purple" | "pink"): Loading... Copy Live Editor <Stack> <Spinner size="M" colorScheme="pink" /> <Spinner size="M" colorScheme="orange" /> <Spinner size="M" colorScheme="cyanblue" /> </Stack>

If you need to hide the , you can set the hidden prop to true, or use a ternary JSX statement: Loading... Copy Live Editor function demo() { const [visible, setVisible] = React.useState(true); return ( Example of hiding with propㅤ"hidden" Example of conditional rendering {visible ? : ""} ); }

size Descriptionsize of the <Spinner/>. Type"XS" | "S" | "M" | "L" | "XL" Default"S" colorScheme DescriptionShows last divider if set to true. Type"red" | "orange" | "yellow" | "green" | "cyangreen" | "cyanblue" | "blue" | "purple" | "pink" hidden DescriptionHidden if set to true. Typeboolean

To use Matro UI in your project, run one of the following commands in your terminal: npm yarn pnpm bun npm install matro-ui Copy yarn add matro-ui Copy pnpm add matro-ui Copy bun add matro-ui Copy After installing Matra UI, no further actions are required. Currently, we do not use the Context Provider for custom theme settings. However, this will change in the near future.

Here's a quick example of how you can do it using something like Create React App: import React from "react"; import * as ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; import { Button } from "matro-ui"; ReactDOM.render( <Button>This button looks great.</Button>, document.getElementById("root") ); Copy

You've successfully installed Matro UI and added your first component to your project. Now, you're ready to dive deeper and explore the full range of components and features Matro UI has to offer. Whether you're building a simple website or a complex web application, Matro UI provides you with the tools you need to create beautiful and functional user interfaces. To explore more components, check out the components overview page. Happy coding!
info This item is currently under construction and will be available in v.0.9.1.
Matro UI converts theme tokens (fontSize, color, shape etc.) to CSS Variables by deafult. info This item is currently under construction and will be available in v.0.9.1.
Style props is a simple way to alter the style of a component by simply passing props to it. info This item is currently under construction and will be available in v.0.9.1.
